info.description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Compute resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a cluster
  • Get a cluster
  • Patch a cluster
  • Delete a cluster
  • Get keys for a cluster
  • Check if updates are available for system services in a cluster
  • Update system services in a cluster
  • Get all clusters in a resource group
  • Get all clusters in a subscription
info.title: Machine Learning Compute Management Client

parameters.description: The version of the Microsoft.MachineLearningCompute resource provider API to use.
parameters.name: api-version

items.description: Resource operation.

display.description: Registers the subscription for the Machine Learning Compute resource provider and enables the management of Machine Leaning Compute resources.
Create or update any operationalization cluster
List keys for an operationalization cluster
display.operation: List keys for an operationalization cluster

display.description: Check available system updates for an operationalization cluster
display.operation: Check available system updates for an operationalization cluster

display.description: Apply available system updates for an operationalization cluster
display.operation: Apply available system updates for an operationalization cluster

get.description: Gets the operationalization clusters in the specified subscription.

parameters.description: The version of the Microsoft.MachineLearningCompute resource provider API to use.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: Continuation token for pagination.
parameters.name: $skiptoken

200.description: OK. The response includes a paginated array of cluster objects and a URI to the next set of results, if any. Note that the cluster objects are sparsely populated to conserve space in the response content. To get the full cluster object, call the GET operation on the cluster.

nextLink.description: A continuation link (absolute URI) to the next page of results in the list.

location.description: Specifies the location of the resource.

name.description: Specifies the name of the resource.

tags.description: Contains resource tags defined as key/value pairs.

type.description: Specifies the type of the resource.

items.description: Instance of an Azure ML Operationalization Cluster resource.

resourceId.description: ARM resource ID of the App Insights.
ARM resource ID of the Azure Container Registry used to store Docker images for web services in the cluster. If not provided one will be created. This cannot be changed once the cluster is created.

containerService.description: Parameters for the Azure Container Service cluster.

agentCount.description: The number of agent nodes in the Container Service. This can be changed to scale the cluster.

agentVmSize.description: The Azure VM size of the agent VM nodes. This cannot be changed once the cluster is created. This list is non exhaustive; refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/windows/sizes for the possible VM sizes.

masterCount.description: The number of master nodes in the container service.

servicePrincipal.description: The Azure Service Principal used by Kubernetes

secret.description: The service principal secret. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource. To see this please call listKeys.

orchestratorType.description: Type of orchestrator. It cannot be changed once the cluster is created.

systemServices.description: The system services deployed to the cluster

items.description: Information about a system service deployed in the cluster

publicIpAddress.description: The public IP address of the system service

version.description: The state of the system service

createdOn.description: The date and time when the cluster was created.

globalServiceConfiguration.description: Contains global configuration for the web services in the cluster.

maxReplicas.description: The maximum number of replicas for each service.

minReplicas.description: The minimum number of replicas for each service.

status.description: If auto-scale is enabled for all services. Each service can turn it off individually.

serviceAuth.description: Optional global authorization keys for all user services deployed in cluster. These are used if the service does not have auth keys.

primaryAuthKeyHash.description: The primary auth key hash. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource.. To see this please call listKeys API.

secondaryAuthKeyHash.description: The secondary auth key hash. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource.. To see this please call listKeys API.

cert.description: The SSL cert data in PEM format.

key.description: The SSL key data in PEM format. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource. To see this please call listKeys API.

status.description: SSL status. Allowed values are Enabled and Disabled.

modifiedOn.description: The date and time when the cluster was last modified.

provisioningErrors.description: List of provisioning errors reported by the resource provider.

items.description: Wrapper for error response to follow ARM guidelines.

details.description: An array of error detail objects.

items.description: Error detail information.

provisioningState.description: The provision state of the cluster. Valid values are Unknown, Updating, Provisioning, Succeeded, and Failed.

resourceId.description: ARM resource ID of the Azure Storage Account to store CLI specific files. If not provided one will be created. This cannot be changed once the cluster is created.

get.description: Gets the clusters in the specified resource group.

parameters.description: The version of the Microsoft.MachineLearningCompute resource provider API to use.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: Name of the resource group in which the cluster is located.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: Continuation token for pagination.
parameters.name: $skiptoken

200.description: OK. The response includes a paginated array of cluster objects and a URI to the next set of results, if any. For the more information the limits of the number of items in a resource group, see https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/azure-subscription-service-limits/. Note that the cluster objects are sparsely populated to conserve space in the response content. To get the full cluster object, call the GET operation on the cluster.

nextLink.description: A continuation link (absolute URI) to the next page of results in the list.

name.description: Specifies the name of the resource.

tags.description: Contains resource tags defined as key/value pairs.

parameters.description: The version of the Microsoft.MachineLearningCompute resource provider API to use.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: Name of the resource group in which the cluster is located.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the cluster.

parameters.description: If true, deletes all resources associated with this cluster.
parameters.name: deleteAll

202.description: The delete request was accepted and will complete asynchronously. The know the progress of the delete operation do a GET call on the URI in the Location header. For more information about Asynchronous Operations, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/resource-manager-async-operations.

204.description: No Content. The cluster did not exist but the request was well formed.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

schema.description: Wrapper for error response to follow ARM guidelines.

details.description: An array of error detail objects.

items.description: Error detail information.

schema.description: Parameters for PATCH operation on an operationalization cluster

tags.description: Gets or sets a list of key value pairs that describe the resource. These tags can be used in viewing and grouping this resource (across resource groups). A maximum of 15 tags can be provided for a resource. Each tag must have a key no greater in length than 128 characters and a value no greater in length than 256 characters.

post.description: Checks if updates are available for system services in the cluster.

parameters.description: The version of the Microsoft.MachineLearningCompute resource provider API to use.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: Name of the resource group in which the cluster is located.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the cluster.
parameters.name: clusterName

schema.description: Information about updates available for system services in a cluster.

updatesAvailable.description: Yes if updates are available for the system services, No if not.

post.description: Gets the credentials for the specified cluster such as Storage, ACR and ACS credentials. This is a long running operation because it fetches keys from dependencies.

parameters.description: The version of the Microsoft.MachineLearningCompute resource provider API to use.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: Name of the resource group in which the cluster is located.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the cluster.
parameters.name: clusterName

schema.description: Credentials to resources in the cluster.

instrumentationKey.description: The AppInsights instrumentation key. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource. To see this please call listKeys API.

loginServer.description: The ACR login server name. User name is the first part of the FQDN.

imagePullSecretName.description: The ACR image pull secret name which was created in Kubernetes.

servicePrincipalConfiguration.description: Service principal configuration used by Kubernetes.

secret.description: The service principal secret. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource. To see this please call listKeys.

serviceAuthConfiguration.description: Global authorization keys for all user services deployed in cluster. These are used if the service does not have auth keys.

primaryAuthKeyHash.description: The primary auth key hash. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource.. To see this please call listKeys API.

secondaryAuthKeyHash.description: The secondary auth key hash. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource.. To see this please call listKeys API.

sslConfiguration.description: The SSL configuration for the services.

cert.description: The SSL cert data in PEM format.

key.description: The SSL key data in PEM format. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource. To see this please call listKeys API.

status.description: SSL status. Allowed values are Enabled and Disabled.

primaryKey.description: The primary key of the storage account.

resourceId.description: The ARM resource ID of the storage account.

secondaryKey.description: The secondary key of the storage account.

post.description: Updates system services in a cluster.

parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The Azure subscription ID.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: Name of the resource group in which the cluster is located.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the cluster.
parameters.name: clusterName

200.description: OK. The request completed successfully. Check the response body for update details.

schema.description: Response of the update system services API

updateCompletedOn.description: The date and time when the last system services update completed.

updateStartedOn.description: The date and time when the last system services update was started.

202.description: The request was accepted and will complete asynchronously. The know the progress of the async operation do a GET call on the URI in the Location header. For more information about Asynchronous Operations, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/resource-manager-async-operations.

AcsClusterProperties.description: Information about the container service backing the cluster

agentCount.description: The number of agent nodes in the Container Service. This can be changed to scale the cluster.

agentVmSize.description: The Azure VM size of the agent VM nodes. This cannot be changed once the cluster is created. This list is non exhaustive; refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/windows/sizes for the possible VM sizes.

masterCount.description: The number of master nodes in the container service.

servicePrincipal.description: The Azure Service Principal used by Kubernetes

secret.description: The service principal secret. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource. To see this please call listKeys.

orchestratorType.description: Type of orchestrator. It cannot be changed once the cluster is created.

systemServices.description: The system services deployed to the cluster

items.description: Information about a system service deployed in the cluster

publicIpAddress.description: The public IP address of the system service

version.description: The state of the system service

instrumentationKey.description: The AppInsights instrumentation key. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource. To see this please call listKeys API.

resourceId.description: ARM resource ID of the App Insights.

maxReplicas.description: The maximum number of replicas for each service.

minReplicas.description: The minimum number of replicas for each service.

status.description: If auto-scale is enabled for all services. Each service can turn it off individually.

items.description: Resource operation.

CheckSystemServicesUpdatesAvailableRespo.description: Information about updates available for system services in a cluster.

updatesAvailable.description: Yes if updates are available for the system services, No if not.

ContainerRegistryCredentials.description: Information about the Azure Container Registry which contains the images deployed to the cluster.

loginServer.description: The ACR login server name. User name is the first part of the FQDN.

resourceId.description: ARM resource ID of the Azure Container Registry used to store Docker images for web services in the cluster. If not provided one will be created. This cannot be changed once the cluster is created.

ContainerServiceCredentials.description: Information about the Azure Container Registry which contains the images deployed to the cluster.

imagePullSecretName.description: The ACR image pull secret name which was created in Kubernetes.

servicePrincipalConfiguration.description: Service principal configuration used by Kubernetes.

secret.description: The service principal secret. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource. To see this please call listKeys.

details.description: An array of error detail objects.

items.description: Error detail information.

ErrorResponseWrapper.description: Wrapper for error response to follow ARM guidelines.

details.description: An array of error detail objects.

items.description: Error detail information.

GlobalServiceConfiguration.description: Global configuration for services in the cluster.

maxReplicas.description: The maximum number of replicas for each service.

minReplicas.description: The minimum number of replicas for each service.

status.description: If auto-scale is enabled for all services. Each service can turn it off individually.

serviceAuth.description: Optional global authorization keys for all user services deployed in cluster. These are used if the service does not have auth keys.

primaryAuthKeyHash.description: The primary auth key hash. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource.. To see this please call listKeys API.

secondaryAuthKeyHash.description: The secondary auth key hash. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource.. To see this please call listKeys API.

cert.description: The SSL cert data in PEM format.

key.description: The SSL key data in PEM format. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource. To see this please call listKeys API.

status.description: SSL status. Allowed values are Enabled and Disabled.

secret.description: The service principal secret. This is not returned in response of GET/PUT on the resource. To see this please call listKeys.

tags.description: Gets or sets a list of key value pairs that describe the resource. These tags can be used in viewing and grouping this resource (across resource groups).
